text: There’s not like a webpack for design manager.  Locally, you can use whatever you like to generate files, and then use the HubSpot cli to upload them to your portal… e.g. you can set up a webpack build to parse all your local .scss files and generate a global.css file, use hscms upload global.css to your portal, then import global.css via the website settings, or as a dependency in a template or module.
Additionally, I believe HubSpot is supposed to combine your css dependencies into a single file, but I think we’ve found that doesn’t always work as expected. They use http2 anyway, so nbd.

I’ve been using Tailwind CLI (in JIT mode) w/ HubSpot recently and have found it pretty nice. Had a thread going from last week with some details <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CCQ7H31D5/p1624634131133600>
<@U01FH92LP6W> I'm working on a post that should help you get the general idea (although I use SCSS as well): <https://www.fasterbetter.dev/blog/setting-up-webpack-in-HubSpot>
